summary: This document is an email chain from September 2020 between Gary Bloxsome of Blackfords LLP and U.S. prosecutors regarding a client's offer to provide a written witness statement for the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case. The client's lawyers negotiate the terms, offering a statement limited to the indictment period (1994-1997) but willing to answer written questions on events outside that period, while refusing a voluntary interview.

persons.name: Gary Bloxsome
persons.context: The sender of the main email, representing a client in negotiations with U.S. prosecutors regarding providing evidence in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Daniel Cundy
persons.context: Copied on emails and sends a prior email with legal reference materials regarding protections for compelled testimony.

persons.name: Jennifer Richardson
persons.context: A prosecutor with the Southern District of New York corresponding with defense lawyers about obtaining evidence from their client.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal indictment (U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell) for which the defense lawyer's client is offering to provide a witness statement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Ghislaine Maxwell as someone the defense lawyer's client had an association with and knowledge of.

connections.description: Both are partners at the same law firm, Blackfords LLP, working on the same client matter.
Bloxsome, as defense attorney, is negotiating the terms of his client's cooperation with prosecutor Richardson.
The unnamed client had an association with Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, and possesses knowledge relevant to Maxwell's prosecution.
Mentioned together as associates, with Maxwell being prosecuted for crimes related to Epstein.

events.title: Offer of Written Witness Statement
events.description: Gary Bloxsome formally offers, on behalf of his client, to provide a written witness statement and answer written questions for the Maxwell prosecution.

locations: London, England (Blackfords LLP office at 15 Old Bailey, EC4M 7EF)
New York, NY, USA (Southern District of New York office at 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, 10007)
Croydon, England (Blackfords LLP registered address at Hill House, 1 Mint Walk, CR0 1EA)
keyFacts: An unnamed client of Blackfords LLP, represented by Gary Bloxsome, offered to provide a written witness statement for the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case.
The client's lawyers refused a voluntary interview with U.S. prosecutors but offered written answers, even to questions about events outside the 1994-1997 indictment period.
The defense lawyers insisted that their client be treated as a witness, not a subject, and demanded strict confidentiality for any information provided.
The correspondence reveals ongoing negotiations between UK defense lawyers and U.S. prosecutors in 2020 regarding evidence collection for the Maxwell trial.
The client is described as having an association with both Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein and knowledge relevant to the prosecution.
